results.definition: an informal term for a father; probably derived from baby talk
music of general appeal to teenagers; a bland watered-down version of rock'n'roll with more rhythm and harmony and an emphasis on romantic love
a sharp explosive sound as from a gunshot or drawing a cork
a sweet drink containing carbonated water and flavoring
(of music or art) new and of general appeal (especially among young people)

examples: They popped a few beer after work
The farm popped into view as we turned the corner
He suddenly popped up out of nowhere

results.definition: burst open with a sharp, explosive sound
examples: This popcorn pops quickly in the microwave oven

results.definition: cause to burst with a loud, explosive sound
cause to make a sharp explosive sound
fire a weapon with a loud explosive noise

examples: He popped me on the head
The cork of the champagne bottle popped

results.definition: put or thrust suddenly and forcefully
examples: pop the pizza into the microwave oven
He popped the petit-four into his mouth
The man charged with murder popped a valium to calm his nerves
